State and Private Forestry, Forest Service

description.narrative: To extend Forest Service efforts to improve forest policies and practices internationally, address climate change, conserve and protect critical global forest environments and resources, and improve the lives of forest-dependent peoples by awarding grants to and entering into cooperative agreements with nonprofit organizations, multilateral organizations, and other individuals, organizations, institutions, and governments engaged in forest conservation and management.

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

description.narrative: From April 16-30, 2016, DTRA funded an effort to develop a Philippines veterinary training strategy based on gaps identified by the APHIS/Manila Office and a planned scoping mission in spring 2016.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Philippines - Animal Disease Outbreak Response Management

description.narrative: From July 15-23, 2016, the Animal Disease Outbreak Response Management Training was held in the Philippines. The subject matter experts attending the training conducted lectures on topics such as: Managing Crisis Situations, Epidemiological Analysis and Response, Epidemiological Tools, Risk Analysis, and a one-day case study.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

description.narrative: The course supported the Philippines in developing, planning and coordinating between Regional QRTs, provincial veterinary responders, emergency staff, and private practitioners/veterinary schools

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Foreign Agricultural Service, Salaries and Expenses
Foreign Agricultural Service, Salaries and Expenses

description.narrative: The Food for Progress Program provides for the donation of U.S. agricultural commodities to developing countries and emerging democracies that are committed to introducing or expanding free enterprise in their agricultural economies. The program has two primary strategic objectives: (1) increase agricultural productivity and (2) expand trade of agricultural products.

description.narrative: The Scientific Exchange Program (SEP) advances USDAs agricultural research goals to promote collaborative programs among agricultural professionals of eligible countries, the United States, the international agricultural research system, and United States entities conducting research in the agricultural sciences.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Foreign Agricultural Service, Salaries and Expenses

description.narrative: The Faculty Exchange Program enhances the teaching ability of agricultural educators from institutions of higher learning in developing countries. Participants come to the United States for one academic semester (4-5 months) to increase their knowledge of, and ability to teach, agricultural economics, marketing, business and law in a market-based economy.
